{{Infobox musical artist | name = Houston County | image = | origin = [[Houston County, Alabama]], United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2006-2009 | label = [[Stroudavarious Records|Stroudavarious]] | associated_acts = [[James Stroud]] | website = | past_members = Adam Hooper
Zack Hooper
John Milldrum }} '''Houston County''' was an American [[country music]] trio formerly signed to [[Stroudavarious Records]]. The group is composed of brothers Zack Hooper ([[lead vocals]]) and Adam Hooper ([[bass guitar]]), as well as John Milldrum ([[lead guitar]]). The trio released its debut single "I Can't Make It Rain" in September 2009, and it debuted at No. 58 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart dated for the week of October 31, 2009. Karlie Justus of Engine 145 gave the song a thumbs-up, saying that it had "weak opening chords" but that it was "lyrically interesting."{{cite web |author=Karlie Justus |title=Houston County â€” "I Can't Make It Rain" |url=http://www.engine145.com/houston-county-i-cant-make-it-rain/ |work=Engine 145 |date=2009-09-03 |accessdate=2009-10-19 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218105927/http://www.engine145.com/houston-county-i-cant-make-it-rain/ |archivedate=2014-12-18 }} The band has also filmed a [[music video]] for this song. {{cite web |author=Peggy Ussery |title=Houston County band to film video in downtown Dothan |url=http://www2.dothaneagle.com/dea/news/local/article/houston_county_band_to_film_video_in_downtown_dothan/99281/ |archive-url=https://archive.today/20110809031308/http://www2.dothaneagle.com/dea/news/local/article/houston_county_band_to_film_video_in_downtown_dothan/99281/ |url-status=dead |archive-date=August 9, 2011 |work=Dothan Eagle |date=2009-10-10 |accessdate=2009-10-19 }} ==Discography== ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single !
